Function Documentation

int32_t VoipHeadsetControl ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Control function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iControl- control selector
iValue- control value
iValue2- control value
*pValue- control value
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        'cdec' - create new codec
        'cide' - close voip input device
        'code' - close voip output device
        'edev' - enumerate voip input/output devices
        'idev' - select voip input device
        'loop' - enable/disable loopback
        'micr' - enable/disable recording
        'odev' - select voip output device
        'play' - enable/disable playing
        'svol' - changes speaker volume
Version
07/28/2004 (jbrookes)

References VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::bChangeDevice, VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::bCloseDevice, VoipHeadsetRefT::bLoopback, VoipHeadsetRefT::bMicOn, VoipHeadsetRefT::bParticipating, VoipHeadsetRefT::DevChangeCrit, VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::eDevType, FALSE, VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::iActiveDevice, VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::iDeviceToOpen, VoipHeadsetRefT::iPlayerActive, VoipHeadsetRefT::MicrInfo, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, VoipHeadsetRefT::pConduitRef, VoipHeadsetRefT::pPlayerBuffer, VoipHeadsetRefT::SpkrInfo, TRUE, VoipHeadsetRefT::uPlayerBufferFrameCurrent, VoipHeadsetRefT::uPlayerBufferFrames, VoipHeadsetRefT::uPlayerFirstTime, VOIP_CODEC_ACTIVE, VOIP_HEADSET_FRAMESAMPLES, VOIP_HEADSET_INPDEVICE, VOIP_HEADSET_SAMPLEWIDTH, VoipCodecControl(), VoipConduitControl(), and VoipHeadsetSetVolume().

VoipHeadsetRefT* VoipHeadsetCreate ( int32_t  iMaxConduits,
VoipHeadsetMicDataCbT *  pMicDataCb,
VoipHeadsetStatusCbT *  pStatusCb,
void *  pCbUserData,
int32_t  iData 
)

Create the headset manager.

Parameters
iMaxConduits- max number of conduits
*pMicDataCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when mic data is ready
*pStatusCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when headset status changes
*pCbUserData- pointer to user callback data
iData- platform-specific - unused for PC
Returns
VoipHeadsetRefT * - pointer to module state, or NULL if an error occured
Version
03/30/2004 (jbrookes)

int32_t VoipHeadsetStatus ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Status function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iSelect- control selector
iValue- selector specific
*pBuf- buffer pointer
iBufSize- buffer size
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iSelect can be one of the following:
        'ndev' - zero
        'idev' - get name of input device at index iValue (-1 returns number of input devices)
        'odev' - get name of output device at index iValue (-1 returns number of input devices)
        'idft' - get the default input device index (as specified in control panel)
        'odft' - get the default output device index (as specified in control panel)
        'ruid' - always return TRUE because MLU is not supported on PC
Version
07/28/2004 (jbrookes)

References DRVM_MAPPER_CONSOLEVOICECOM_GET, ds_memcpy(), VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::iNumDevices, VoipHeadsetRefT::MicrInfo, VoipHeadsetRefT::SpkrInfo, VoipHeadsetWaveCapsT::szPname, TRUE, VOIP_HEADSET_WAVE_MAPPER, and VoipHeadsetDeviceInfoT::WaveDeviceCaps.

Referenced by VoipCommonApplyChannelConfig(), and VoipCommonStatus().
